## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 337685577.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz -int 187465780 187465780 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr1_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 699 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr1.strand]
 --read strand info for 1958 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1979 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0003/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3643 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2009 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1979 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1634 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --724 type 2 SNPs
 --188 type 3 SNPs
 --912 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --909 type 2 SNPs
 --158 type 3 SNPs
 --1067 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1980 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1633 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [187465780,187465780]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 266 [Panel 1->2]

---------

---------

MCMC iteration [30/30]


diploid sampling success rate: 0.994

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 783373512.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz -int 5030822 5030822 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0014/output_warnings

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1182697848.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz -int 59257464 59257464 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr10_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 811 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr10.strand]
 --read strand info for 1490 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 2061 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 7 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0016/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 30 individuals
 --read 3002 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1453 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2061 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1549 SNPs with data in multiple panels

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 465250076.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz -int 85189259 85189259 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr16_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 764 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr16.strand]
 --read strand info for 2887 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 2813 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 --flipped strand at 0 out of 16 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0031/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 132 individuals
 --read 5502 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 3163 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2813 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 2339 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1565672757.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz -int 28021157 28021157 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr21.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr21.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr21_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0045/output_warnings

-----------------

-----------------

 --flipped strand at 0 out of 12 SNPs

 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 4070 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

 Imputation accuracy assessment

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 684156385.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz -int 162546619 162546619 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 726 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand]
 --read strand info for 2578 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 2485 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 14 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0052si/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 6 individuals
 --read 1796 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 370 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 2485 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1426 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------

--------------

[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-In total, 2486 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1425 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz -int 31009658 31009658 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

1 warning was generated during this run. See the warnings file [tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0058/output_warnings] for details.

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 229049442.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/input.gen.gz -int 107170044 107170044 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr6.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr6_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0061/output_warnings

-----------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1565672757.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz -int 76898266 76898266 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr9_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 598 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr9.strand]
 --read strand info for 2306 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1380 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 6 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0068/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 132 individuals
 --read 3178 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2054 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1380 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1124 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

-Upstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --654 type 2 SNPs
 --132 type 3 SNPs
 --786 total SNPs

-Downstream buffer region
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --0 type 1 SNPs
 --469 type 2 SNPs
 --125 type 3 SNPs
 --594 total SNPs

-Analysis region (as defined by -int argument)
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs
 --1 total SNPs

-Output file
 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1381 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1123 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

----------------
 Run parameters 
----------------

        reference diplotypes: 132 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]
           sequence interval: [76898266,76898266]
                      buffer: 250 kb
                          Ne: 20000
           input call thresh: 0.900
     burn-in MCMC iterations: 10
       total MCMC iterations: 30 (20 used for inference)
      HMM states for phasing: 80 [Panel 1]; 80 [Panel 2]
   HMM states for imputation: 264 [Panel 1->2]

diploid sampling success rate: 0.994

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1106761359.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/input.gen.gz -int 88852932 88852932 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr4.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr4_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0095/output_warnings

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 1744549297.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz -int 41362974 41362974 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr3_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 618 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr3.strand]
 --read strand info for 2038 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1931 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 7 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0098/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 3819 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 2181 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1931 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1638 SNPs with data in multiple panels

## 4 OTHER FILES: Recombination map and strand file ###############
## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 540203229.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz -int 40879922 40879922 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/output_warnings

-----------------
 Data processing 
-----------------

-reading genetic map from -m file
 --filename=[data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr7_combined_b37.txt]
 --read 571 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-reading strand info for Panel 2 from -strand_g file
 --filename=[data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr7.strand]
 --read strand info for 1704 SNPs in the analysis region

-reading Panel 2 genotypes from -g file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/input.gen.gz]
 --detected 3 individuals
 --read 1623 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-using -strand_g file to align Panel 2 allele labels
 --flipped strand at 0 out of 8 SNPs

-reading Panel 1 genotypes from -g_ref file
 --filename=[tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0105/reference.gen.gz]
 --detected 133 individuals
 --read 2844 SNPs in the analysis interval+buffer region

-removing SNPs that violate the hierarchical data requirements
 --no SNPs removed

-removing reference-only SNPs from buffer region
 --removed 1617 SNPs

-checking strand alignment between Panel 2 and Panel 1 by allele labels
 --flipped strand due to allele mismatch at 0 out of 1623 SNPs in Panel 2

-aligning allele labels between panels

-removing non-aligned genotyped SNPs
 --removed 0 out of 1227 SNPs with data in multiple panels

--------------
 Data summary 
--------------

[type 0 = SNP in Panel 0 only]
[type 1 = SNP in Panel 1]
[type 2 = SNP in Panel 2 and all ref panels]
[type 3 = SNP in Panel 2 only]

 --0 type 3 SNPs

 --0 type 0 SNPs
 --1 type 1 SNPs
 --0 type 2 SNPs
 --0 type 3 SNPs

-In total, 1624 SNPs will be used in the analysis, including 1226 Panel 2 SNPs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 2 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-making initial haplotype guesses for Panel 1 by phasing hets at random and imputing missing genotypes from allele freqs

-setting storage space
-setting mutation matrices
-setting switch rates

        reference diplotypes: 133 [Panel 1]
           study individuals: 3 [Panel 2]

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

 Imputation accuracy assessment

For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0

Have a nice day!

## 5 IMPUTE2: Run imputation #######################################

======================
 IMPUTE version 2.3.2 
======================

Copyright 2008 Bryan Howie, Peter Donnelly, and Jonathan Marchini
Please see the LICENCE file included with this program for conditions of use.

The seed for the random number generator is 56197117.

Command-line input: code/software/impute_v2.3.2_x86_64_static/impute2 -g_ref tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz -g tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz -int 314890 314890 -k_hap 500 -o tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output -m data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt -strand_g data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr11.strand

---------------------------------
 Nomenclature and data structure 
---------------------------------

     Panel 1: unphased reference genotypes
     Panel 2: unphased study genotypes

For optimal results, each successive panel (0,1,2) should contain a subset of the SNPs in the previous panel. When the data structure deviates from this ideal configuration, IMPUTE2 tries to use as much of the available information as possible; see documentation for details.

-------------
 Input files 
-------------

          Panel 1 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/reference.gen.gz
          Panel 2 genotypes: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/input.gen.gz
        Panel 2 strand info: data/use/avery_individuals/20ind_ref_chr11.strand
                genetic map: data/raw/1000genomes_hg19_maps/genetic_map_chr11_combined_b37.txt

--------------
 Output files 
--------------

                main output: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output
                SNP QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_info
             sample QC info: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_info_by_sample
                run summary: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_summary
                warning log: tmp/2020-04-22_06_imputation/imputationProcess/AFR_500/HsInv0124/output_warnings

haploid sampling success rate: (no haploid sampling performed)


--------------------------------
 Imputation accuracy assessment 
--------------------------------

The table below is based on an internal cross-validation that is performed during each IMPUTE2 run. For this analysis, the program masks the genotypes of one variant at a time in the study data (Panel 2) and imputes the masked genotypes by using the remaining study and reference data. The imputed genotypes are then compared with the original genotypes to produce the concordance statistics shown in the table. You can learn more about this procedure and the contents of the table at http://mathgen.stats.ox.ac.uk/impute/concordance_table_description.html.

In the current analysis, IMPUTE2 masked, imputed, and evaluated 0 genotypes that were called with high confidence (maximum probability >= 0.90) in the Panel 2 input file (-g or -known_haps_g).

When the masked study genotypes were imputed with reference data from Panel 1, the concordance between original and imputed genotypes was as follows:

  Interval  #Genotypes %Concordance         Interval  %Called %Concordance
  [0.0-0.1]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.0]    -nan          0.0
  [0.1-0.2]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.1]    -nan          0.0
  [0.2-0.3]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.2]    -nan          0.0
  [0.3-0.4]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.3]    -nan          0.0
  [0.4-0.5]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.4]    -nan          0.0
  [0.5-0.6]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.5]    -nan          0.0
  [0.6-0.7]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.6]    -nan          0.0
  [0.7-0.8]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.7]    -nan          0.0
  [0.8-0.9]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.8]    -nan          0.0
  [0.9-1.0]          0          0.0         [ >= 0.9]    -nan          0.0
